intro: Schoenoplectus × osoreyamensis, commonly known as the Osoreyama bulrush, is a hybrid plant species native to Japan. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its tall, cylindrical stems and dense clusters of small, greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland environments such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the study of wetland flora and hybridization in plants.
